Text: I agree with that. I don't think it's right that anybody from a foreign country can contribute to our elections. Text: I think finding someone for not voting shouldn't happen, especially when they're so many people not allowed to vote.
Because they've been in jail and served their time and still can't vote when they get out and our citizens.
All Arguments Summarized:
It is unconstitutional to deny former prisoners the right to vote after they have served their time. This denial disproportionately affects African American citizens. Therefore, it is important to:

1. Recognize the voting rights of former prisoners who have completed their sentences.
2. Address the disproportionate impact of felony disenfranchisement on African American communities.
3. Uphold constitutional principles by ensuring the voting rights of all citizens, including former prisoners.
other: Address the disproportionate impact of felony disenfranchisement on African American communities
notRelevant: is unconstitutional to deny former prisoners the right to vote after they have served their time  This denial disproportionately affects African American citizens  Therefore, it is important to:  Recognize the voting rights of former prisoners who have completed their sentences  Uphold constitutional principles by ensuring the voting rights of all citizens, including former prisoners
